definition: to mix/to mix in/to toss (a salad)

sentences.english: They had words with their neighbors over small trifles.
sentences.chinese: 他们为了一些小事同邻居拌嘴。

sentences.english: Married couples are advised to avoid arguments and confrontations in this month.
sentences.chinese: 步入婚姻围城的情侣最好不要在本月发生拌嘴和争执。

sentences.english: Because of the family, the girl is strongly opposed to mix with the boy.
sentences.chinese: 由于家人的强烈反对，女孩也常与男孩拌嘴。

sentences.english: All evening her husband contrasted everything she said .
sentences.chinese: 整个晚上她说什么，丈夫都和她拌嘴。

sentences.english: The two friends wrangled and now they don't speak to each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个朋友拌嘴了，现在他们都不和对方说话。

definition: to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
